verses.roman:
bhikṣuka sannyāsī āmi nirjana-vāsī
āmāya duḥkha deya, nija-duḥkha kahi' āsi'

synonyms: bhikṣuka—beggar; sannyāsī—mendicant; āmi—I; nirjana-vāsī—living in a solitary place; āmāya—to Me; duḥkha—unhappiness; deya—they give; nija-duḥkha—their own unhappiness; kahi'-speaking; āsi'-coming.
translation: "As a beggar sannyāsī, a mendicant, I wish to live alone in a solitary place, but these people come to tell Me about their unhappiness and disturb Me.
